meanings.definition: To give a definite structure or form to (something)
meanings.sent1: She likes to structuralize her essays by creating outlines first.
meanings.sent2: It is important to structuralize your thoughts before starting a project.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to structuralize their messy desks for a fun activity.
meanings.sent4: His detailed drawings structuralize the chaos of the city into organized patterns.
meanings.sent5: The architect's blueprint helped him structuralize his vision for the new building.

meanings.definition: To organize or arrange in a structured manner
meanings.sent1: They need to structuralize the files in alphabetical order for easy access.
meanings.sent2: The team will structuralize the data to present it in a clear way.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to structuralize their toys by color for a game.
meanings.sent4: Her methodical approach helped her structuralize the project timeline effectively.
meanings.sent5: The company plans to structuralize their workflow for better efficiency.
